course_description: The course explores physical and statistical constraints on strategies used by biological systems, from bacteria, to large organisms, and to entire populations, to sense external environmental signals, process them, and shape a response.
prerequisites: (BIOL 212 or PHYS 212 or BIOL_OX 212 or PHYS_OX 212) and PHYS 220 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 3979, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 9:40-10:55a, Instructor: L. Finzi, Status: Open
